description: Internally illuminated signage associated with ATM cash machine dispenser (Advertisement Consent)
decision_conditions: 1.	The consent shall expire after a period of 5 years from the date of this notice. | 2.	Any advertisements displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a clean and tidy condition to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority. | 3.	Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a safe condition. | 4.	Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the removal shall be carried out to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority. | 5.	No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission. | 6.	No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to obscure, or hinder the ready interpretation of, any road traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air, or so as otherwise to render hazardous the use of any highway, waterway (including any coastal waters), railway or aerodrome (civil or military). | The brightness of the illuminated advertisement shall meet the recommendations made in the Institution of Lighting Professionals Technical Report No.5, Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements.    Reason: To ensure public safety is protected in in accordance with Section 8 of the National Planning Policy framework 2012 and Policy 6.3 of the London Plan (2015).    Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.4, and 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document; adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 7.4, 7.5, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015); and National Planning Policy Framework (March 2012).
